results.title: Adolescence and learning disabilities (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Thomas G. Gregory and Lawren Productions
results.brief_description: Promotes general guidelines for understanding and helping the teenager with learning problems. Interviews professionals and specialists who deal with learning-disabled teenagers, and with the adolescents themselves.

results.title: ADMA for short
results.creator_credit: Ronnie Anscombe, James Carr, British Petroleum and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: The building of ADMA enterprise, a special oil drilling platform developed for underwater oil exploration. Exploring for oil on the bed of the Persian Gulf involved the development of this floating platform in a shipyard on Kiel Canal, and the transformation of Das Island, an uninhabited outcrop of rock in the Persian Gulf, into an outpost of industrial civilisation, complete with harbour, airstrip, living quarters and workshops.

results.title: Adelaide: flowers and festival
results.creator_credit: G Shepherd, J.A. Correll and South Australian Government Tourist Bureau
results.brief_description: Scenes in Adelaide showing events in the biennial Festival of Arts 1968. The accent is on Flower Day and its associated pageantry and processions. Snippets of the Festival of Arts demonstrate Adelaide’s attractiveness as a festival venue during vintage time when the weather is still sunny. Narrated by Peter Wells.

results.title: Adelaide: Vintage City
results.brief_description: A panoramic view of the pleasures awaiting visitors to Adelaide, a city set among vineyards, garden suburbs, the sea and the Loft Mountain Ranges. Includes sporting events and the attractive parks, restaurants and lakes.

results.title: Globalisation 101
results.creator_credit: Alex Kelly, Kim Beamish and SKA TV
results.brief_description: Globalisation 101 looks at the impacts of corporate-lead globalisation on workers, indigenous people and the environment both locally and globally. It traces the history of transnational organisations such as the World Bank and International Monetary Fund and charts the origins of third world debt.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alex Kelly, Kim Beamish and SKA TV

results.title: Screens and screams [the movie]
results.brief_description: In October 2002, just before opening at Federation Square, ACMI and the City of Melbourne asked the Kids Own Publishing Partnership from Ireland to run a workshop for over 300 primary school students from 8 schools in the city. Each group of kids had a different job to do - some made and filmed shadow puppets, some acted, some digitally animated, and some created an original soundtrack with artists from the Melbourne Symphony Orchestra. The result was the very first Made @ACMI student movie ‘Screens and Screams’

results.title: Adelaide celebrations
results.creator_credit: Penny Chapman, Terry Jennings, Lesley Hammond and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Excerpts from the many theatre arts and crafts on display at Adelaide Festival time. An interesting study of Adelaide at the time of its biennial festival of the arts, in 1976.

results.title: Adelaide advances
results.creator_credit: Carl Kayser, Auster Films and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A description of the city and suburbs of Adelaide since foundation. A father is driving his son to one of the research laboratories and as they approach the city, he tells the boy of local industries and the contributions made to the South Australian economy by the Agricultural Research Institute. Includes scenes of the landmarks of the city and a visit to the Onkaparinga Racecourse. Sponsored by the Australian News & Information Bureau and narrated by David Low.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Carl Kayser, Auster Films and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.description: A description of the city and suburbs of Adelaide since foundation. results.title: Fly
results.brief_description:
Winner of the Digital Pictures Award for best short dance film/video
was ‘Fly’ (2002) by New Zealand choreographer/director Shona
McCullough. Shona’s film, with performances from Richard Cesan and
John Callan, is a poignant story, told in dance/sign language, about
a 15 year old boy who wants to escape and 54 year old man who must
learn to let go.

results.title: Noise TV - Darebin Music Feast
results.brief_description:
In this episode of Noise TV we join host Shane Laffy, who introduces us to Mayor Vince Fontana for the opening of the Darebin Music Feast, a community celebration inviting and encouraging us to participate in finding expression through the arts, sharing and benefiting from the diverse cultural experiences that enrich our very own continually developing and unique Australian style and identity.
Featuring an original music score by composer Simon Moore with TheNoise performers and performances on this show include, quirky street horn players, Five Angry Men, the infectious dance drum rythms of the Tumbarumba Samba School & Latin Soulfire Dancers, the amazing Soukous Ba Congo,featuring the soulful vocals of King Bell, Kurdish expert instrumentalist Dursam Akar, a tribute concert for pioneer Greek composer Thymios Stathoulopoulos, featuring vocals from mother and daughter Yiota and Maria Stathoulopoulos, and the ever popular sound of Janine Marshall and Neil Robe.
